author: Eoghan Moloney
title: Three Ireland to cut up to 150 jobs nationwide after ‘lower earnings’ and rising costs
text: Three Ireland to cut up to 150 jobs nationwide after ‘lower earnings’ and rising costs The move will effect close to one in nine employees as it currently has more than 1,300 workers in Ireland. Three Ireland are to cut up to 150 jobs across the country as part of a collective redundancy process. The move will effect close to one in nine employees as it currently has more than 1,300 workers in Ireland. Most of its workers are based in Dublin but they also operate a centre in Limerick. In a statement released this evening, the company confirmed they will begin a collective redundancy process after a year of lower profits and rising costs. "Three Ireland can confirm it has made the difficult decision to enter a proposed collective redundancy process for the business and as a result, a number of roles will be impacted. Read more "We expect approximately 130-150 roles may be impacted, although the actual number will be determined in due course. “Prior to reaching this difficult decision, Three Ireland has implemented a number of measures in a bid to reduce operating costs. However, the business continues to experience commercial performance challenges, with lower earnings and margin growth year on year, as operating costs continue to increase. "The measures announced today position the business on a stronger platform for the future, ensuring it can maintain its market leading position and will enable growth.” a spokesperson said.

author: John Martin MONAGHAN
title: Pirates hit by further resignations amid growing tensions in party
text:
Another elected representative has quit the Pirates, the latest in a series of resignations from the party, which is at the centre of an investigation by the EU’s public prosecutor into allegations of fraud.
Tammy Broers, a councillor in Esch-sur-Alzette, has become the latest figure to resign, the Pirates’ co-ordinator Marc Goergen wrote in a post on social media site X on Wednesday evening.
“Tammy Broers (Esch) informed us this evening that she is leaving the Pirate Party,” wrote Goergen, who is one of just two Pirate Party MPs.
Broers intends to join the Greens, as does the president of the Pirates’ branch in Esch-sur-Alzette, Patrick Steffen, RTL reported. Around a quarter of the 19 councillors elected for the Pirates in last June’s local elections have since quit the party.
There was a lot of “bullying and bashing each other” within the Pirates, Broers told RTL on Thursday, adding: “There was no longer any cohesion. It was unbearable.”
Luxembourg City councillor Marie-Marthe Muller, who only took up her post in June this year, and member of parliament Ben Polidori are among those who have defected to the LSAP. The Pirates accused the socialist party of the “theft” of its elected representatives in a statement issued at the end of September.
Several elected representatives have quit the Pirates in recent months, following the publication in June of a Luxembourg Times and Luxemburger Wort investigation which revealed that the national refugee office (ONA) is trying to reclaim over €92,000 from the Pirates for work on a translation app called Malt.
The European Public Prosecutor’s Office (EPPO) said earlier this week that it has taken over an investigation into the contract from the Luxembourg prosecutor.
Following the initial revelations in June, Marc Goergen publicly distanced himself from Clement and accused him of bullying party colleagues and bringing the party’s reputation into disrepute over his commercial interests that were at the heart of the Malt contract.
Clement responded by claiming that Goergen had used almost €30,000 in parliamentary funds to pay for private expenses.
The two MPs have since said that they will continue to work independently of each other in parliament.

author: Михаил Делягин; Д Э Н; Заместитель Председателя Комитета Госдумы По Экономической Политике
title: О «замороженных квартирах» и замороженных судьбах военных пенсионеров - Аргументы Недели
text:
Российская бюрократия, всё более равнодушная к нуждам граждан, продолжает игнорировать одну из самых острых социальных проблем — обеспечение жильём военнослужащих и их семей. Закон гарантирует добросовестным защитникам Родины получение жилья, однако на практике это право превращается в долгую и мучительную борьбу с системой. Вместо реальных квартир военным теперь выдают жилищные сертификаты, сумма которых зачастую не покрывает даже минимальные потребности. При этом сроки исполнения государственных обязательств законом не определены, что позволяет чиновникам годами откладывать решение вопроса.
По данным на начало 2024 года, в России насчитывалось около 100 тысяч бесквартирных военных пенсионеров и членов их семей. В Министерстве обороны — около 45 тысяч, в Росгвардии — порядка 5 тысяч. Проблема касается также сотрудников ФСИН, ФСБ и ФСО, которые, по сообщениям, также не получают положенных сертификатов.
В 2024 году на жилищные субсидии было выделено более 80 млрд рублей, что позволило обеспечить жильём лишь около 4 тысяч семей. Однако к началу 2025 года в очереди за квартирами или сертификатами оставались более 48 тысяч военнослужащих. Министр обороны Андрей Белоусов объявил о дополнительном финансировании — 149 млрд рублей, что, несмотря на масштаб, покрывает менее четверти потребностей только Министерства обороны.
Парадоксально, что на фоне дефицита жилья для военных по всей стране, включая Москву, стоят замороженные жилые комплексы Минобороны, готовые к сдаче, но оставшиеся недостроенными или невостребованными. Между тем, по словам министра финансов Антона Силуанова, в бюджете на 2025 год предусмотрены остатки средств на счетах в размере 8,2 трлн рублей — эти деньги могли бы решить жилищную проблему военных, если бы были направлены по назначению.
Эксперты отмечают, что в условиях кризиса на рынке недвижимости государство могло бы минимизировать расходы, выкупая у застройщиков нераспроданные квартиры по себестоимости и передавая их отставникам. Это позволило бы не только решить проблему военных, но и поддержать строительную отрасль, избавив её от бремени пустующих объектов.
Однако власти продолжают игнорировать ситуацию. Замминистра строительства утверждает, что у застройщиков нет нераспроданных квартир, а на вторичном рынке жильё продаётся быстро. Подобные заявления вызывают недоумение у специалистов, ведь, по данным Росстата, в 2023 году в России насчитывалось свыше 70 млн кв. м пустующего жилья, а доля непроданных новостроек в некоторых регионах превышала 20%.
Особое возмущение вызывает тот факт, что на фоне хронической нехватки жилья для военных, жилищные сертификаты зачастую получают мигранты и бизнесмены, формально признанные нуждающимися. Такая политика не только обостряет социальное напряжение, но и подрывает доверие к государству среди тех, кто готов защищать Родину.
Показательно, что на четвёртом году СВО государство продолжает публично унижать своих защитников, демонстрируя пренебрежение к самой идее служения Родине. Это становится тревожным сигналом для всех, кто сегодня выбирает путь военной службы.
Мнения, высказываемые в данной рубрике, могут не совпадать с позицией редакции

author: Press Association
title: Josh Magennis on target as Wigan see off Carlisle - The Courier
text:
Josh Magennis on target as Wigan see off Carlisle By Press Association December 29 2023, 9.13pm Share Josh Magennis on target as Wigan see off Carlisle Share via Facebook Twitter Linkedin Whatsapp Messenger Email Post link https://www.thecourier.co.uk/sport/4853637/josh-magennis-on-target-as-wigan-see-off-carlisle/ Copy Link Josh Magennis was on target against Carlisle (Martin Rickett/PA)
Wigan secured a first Sky Bet League One victory in five thanks to a comprehensive 2-0 victory over rock-bottom Carlisle at the DW Stadium.
The visitors – backed by an incredible travelling support of more than 4,000 – were bruised aside by a Wigan side who hit a post inside two minutes thanks to Liam Morrison.
Josh Magennis opened the scoring in the 16th minute from the penalty spot after Stephen Humphrys was tripped in the box by Josh Emmanuel.
Wigan doubled their advantage in the 36th minute when Jonny Smith’s corner was flicked by Charlie Hughes for Morrison to force the ball home at the far post.
And the home side could easily have been further clear at the break, with three decent looking shouts for another penalty – one for a foul and two possible handball shouts – being turned down.
Carlisle did not give up the ghost and came close to at least pulling one back.
Wigan goalkeeper Sam Tickle flicked over a Ryan Edmondson effort before a Jack Robinson free-kick was steered just past the far post by Jack Armer.
Former Wigan striker Joe Garner then headed wide from another Robinson delivery in the closing stages.

author: EIN Presswire
title: 2024 Financial Resolutions: 15 Top Resources to Achieve Goals | Kalkine Media
text: New CardRates finance guide helps people get their personal finances in tip-top shape in the New Year. Making resolutions isnât difficult. Itâs keeping them. With these resources to help, staying on track with your financial resolutions for the next 12 months should be easier than ever.”— Marcie Geffner, a banking expert and journalist for CardRatesGAINESVILLE, FLORIDA, UNITED STATES, December 28, 2023 /EINPresswire.com/ -- CardRates has launched a new guide to help Americans start the new year on the right financial footing. Traditional resolutions can fall by the wayside in the first few months of the year, often becoming strapped by financial issues. A recent CardRates consumer survey* found that 4 in 10 respondents (38%) said they expect to carry credit card debt from holiday shopping into 2024. 15 Top Resources to Achieve Your Financial Resolutions âMaking resolutions isnât difficult. Itâs keeping them. With these resources to help, staying on track with your financial resolutions for the next 12 months should be easier than ever,â said Marcie Geffner, a banking expert and journalist for CardRates.com. 5 Best Books: â¢ âThe Total Money Makeover: A Proven Plan for Financial Fitnessâ â¢ âYour Path to Financial Peace and Freedomâ â¢ âOne Up On Wall Street: How to Use What You Already Know to Make Money in the Marketâ â¢ âThe Psychology of Money: Timeless Lessons on Wealth, Greed, and Happinessâ â¢ âSurviving Debt: Expert Advice for Getting Out of Financial Troubleâ 5 Best Podcasts: â¢ âThe Dave Ramsey Showâ â¢ âSuze Ormanâs Women and Money Podcastâ â¢ âBiggerPockets Real Estateâ and âBiggerPockets Moneyâ podcasts â¢ âPlanet Moneyâ â¢ âYour Money, Your Wealthâ 5 Best Websites and Apps" â¢ Investopedia â¢ Free File â¢ Accounts Checkbook â¢ Debit & Credit App â¢ Your Bankâs App *Survey Methodology: A national online survey of 1,036 U.S. consumers, ages 18 and older, was conducted by Propeller Insights on behalf of CardRates.com in October of 2023. Survey responses were nationally representative of the U.S. population for age, gender, region, and ethnicity. The maximum margin of sampling error was +/- 3 percentage points with a 95% level of confidence. About CardRates.com: CardRates is a financial website that was created to better educate consumers about the benefits and perils of credit cards. To that end, CardRates.comâs finance experts strive to share valuable, well-researched advice, news, and reviews. title: Devils can't hang on to fourth-quarter lead in loss to East Paulding

author: Russia Today
title: Ukrainians want US to stop corruption complaints – NBC — RT World News
text:
Relations between the US and Ukrainian governments have reportedly soured, deteriorating to their lowest point since the conflict with Russia escalated in 2022, partly because of irritation over pressure from Washington to tackle rampant corruption in Kiev.
US and Ukrainian officials privately acknowledge growing friction in the relationship, NBC News reported on Thursday. Kiev’s frustration stems largely from delays in US weapons deliveries and incessant demands to ramp up anti-corruption efforts.
Questions over Ukraine’s corruption problems have led to “repeated disagreement,” current and former government officials told NBC. “Ukrainian officials are particularly irritated with the US ambassador, Bridget Brink, over the issue.”
READ MORE: Pentagon sounds alarm over Ukraine corruption The bilateral strains come at a time when Ukrainian forces are losing ground on the battlefield and the administration of US President Joe Biden is struggling to keep military aid flowing to Kiev. US lawmakers finally approved $61 billion in new Ukraine aid in April, after six months of delays. Biden has been reluctant to authorize increasingly provocative weapons packages for Kiev, such as long-range missiles that Ukraine could use to strike targets deeper in Russian territory.
Ukrainian leaders believe Washington’s ambassador has created “unnecessary tensions” by pressing for more reforms, despite Kiev’s progress in funding an anti-corruption court and a special prosecutor’s office, NBC said. The Biden administration has “lost sight of the overarching priority – winning on the battlefield,” sources close to the government told the media outlet.
READ MORE: US military aid to Ukraine is ‘grift’ – Blackwater founder to Tucker Carlson The US military’s inspector general warned lawmakers in a report last month that the conflict with Russia was creating new opportunities for bribes, kickbacks and other corruption in Ukraine. The report noted multiple scandals involving misuse of defense resources, saying, “Endemic corruption persists” in Kiev, which has “one of the least accountable governments in Europe.”
US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said during a visit to Kiev last month that the Ukrainian government must ensure that “the fight against corruption continues at home just as the fight against Russia’s aggression continues on the front lines.” Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba pushed back on corruption claims in a joint press briefing with Blinken: “If we were as corrupt as the perception says, they simply wouldn’t be giving us any money. They wouldn’t be opening accession talks with Ukraine to accede the European Union, and the United States wouldn’t have trust in Ukraine.”
READ MORE: Zelensky fires officials close to US – WaPo The two governments also have clashed over Biden’s decision not to attend a peace summit organized by Kiev. Ukraine’s Vladimir Zelensky publicly stated that Biden’s presence was needed at the summit and his absence would only be cheered by Russian President Vladimir Putin. Rather than participate in the peace conference, Biden reportedly chose to attend a fundraiser in Los Angeles featuring actor George Clooney and other Hollywood stars.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Game night with RYP and the Hub CoWorks promises to be a fun-filled evening
text:
By Pat ,
5 hours ago Feb. 29 at 5 p.m.—RUTLAND—Rutland Young Professionals (RYP) and The Hub CoWorks are teaming up to host an exciting game night, inviting the community to join them for an evening of friendly competition and camaraderie. The event will take place at The Hub CoWorks, located at 67 Merchants Row, Suite 201 (2nd floor) in Rutland.
Attendees can look forward to an array of board games, card games, and opportunities to connect with fellow community members. Food and beverages will be provided. Guests are encouraged to bring their favorite games and their competitive spirit. Additionally, there will be raffle prizes up for grabs, adding to the excitement of the evening.
Admission to the game night is free, but space is limited, so attendees are encouraged to secure their spot early.
For more information and to reserve a spot visit: thehubvt.com
Courtesy The Hub Co Works
Rutland Young Professionals (RYP) and The Hub CoWorks are partnering to host a game night on Feb. 29 at 5 p.m. at The Hub CoWorks.
The post Game night with RYP and the Hub CoWorks promises to be a fun-filled evening appeared first on The Mountain Times .

text:
